Under certain circumstances, multitasking and parallel processing may be advantageous. Likewise, although several specific implementation details are included in above discussion, these should not be construed as limiting the scope of the present disclosure. Certain features that are described in the context of separate embodiments can also be implemented in combination in a single embodiment. Conversely, various features described in the context of a single embodiment can also be implemented in multiple embodiments individually or in any suitable sub-combination.

Although the subject matter has been described in a language specific to structural features and/or logical actions of the method, it should be understood that the subject matter defined in the appended claims is not necessarily limited to the specific features or actions described above. Rather, the specific features and actions described above are merely exemplary forms of implementing the claims.

claim.claim-text: 1. A video sharing method, characterized in that, used for an electronic device of a first user, comprises:displaying a target call interface, the target call interface being used to make a real-time call between the first user and at least one second user; andwhen a video sharing event is triggered, switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the target sharing interface being used to display a first video shared between the first user and the at least one second user and to keep the real-time call between the first user and the at least one second user.

2. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, the video sharing event being triggered comprises:when a first trigger operation on the target call interface is detected, the video sharing event is triggered;wherein, the first video is a video shared by the first user to the at least one second user.

3. The method of claim 1, characterized in that, the video sharing event being triggered comprises:when a first video data stream of the first video is received, the video sharing event is triggered;wherein, the first video is a video shared by the second user to the first user.
4. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, a video screen synchronized with an electronic device of the second user is displayed in the target sharing interface.

5. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a second video data stream of the second video is received, the first video is replaced with the second video;wherein, the second video is a video shared by the second user to the first user during the process of displaying the first video in the target sharing interface.

6. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a second trigger operation in the target sharing interface is detected, in the target sharing interface, the first video is replaced with a third video chosen by the second trigger operation;wherein, the third video is synchronously shared to the at least one second user.

7. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a first interactive operation on the first video is detected, the target interactive result corresponding to the first interactive operation is displayed in the target sharing interface; and/or,when a first interactive operation on the first video is detected, the target interactive result corresponding to the first interactive operation and the first video targeted by the first interactive operation are displayed in the target sharing interface.

8. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:in a case that the second user performs a second interactive operation on the first video, the first video is kept displayed in the target sharing interface.

9. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a third trigger operation on the target sharing interface is detected, returning to display the target call interface, a target control being displayed in the target call interface; andwhen a fourth trigger operation on the target control is detected, returning to display the target sharing interface.

10. The method according to claim 1, characterized in that, the target sharing interface is further used to display a call control, the call control including a call window for the first user and a call window for the second user.

11. The method according to claim 10, characterized in that, a display size of the call control is determined according to a number of call windows in the call control, and/or the number of call windows is determined according to a number of users in the real-time call.

12. The method according to claim 10, characterized in that, a sharing mark is displayed on a target call window in the call control, the target call window being a call window of a user who is sharing a video.

13. The method according to claim 10, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a fifth trigger operation on the call control is detected, the call control is displayed at a first display position indicated by the fifth trigger operation.

14. The method according to claim 13, characterized in that, after said a fifth trigger operation on the call control being detected, the method further comprises:when an end of the fifth trigger operation is detected, in the case that the first display position is outside a preset display area, the call control is bounced back to a second display position within the preset display area, the second display position being a display position corresponding to the first display position.

15. The method according to claim 10, characterized in that, after said switching the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface, the method further comprises:when a sixth trigger operation on the call control is detected, cancel displaying the call control; anda third control is displayed at a third display position associated with the sixth trigger operation, the third control being used to indicate that the call control is in a minimized state.

16. The method according to claim 15, characterized in that, a user avatar of the user to which the target call window belongs is displayed within the third control, the target call window being a call window of the user who is sharing a video.

17. A video sharing apparatus, characterized in that, used for an electronic device of a first user, comprises:a first display unit configured to display a target call interface, the target call interface being used to make a real-time call between the first user and at least one second user; anda second display unit configured to switch the target call interface to be displayed as a target sharing interface when a video sharing event is triggered, the target sharing interface being used to display a first video shared between the first user and the at least one second user and to keep the real-time call between the first user and the at least one second user.

18. An electronic device, characterized in that, comprises:a processor; anda memory used to store an executable instruction;wherein, the processor is used to read the executable instruction from the memory, and execute the executable instruction to implement the video sharing method according to claim 1.

19. A computer-readable storage medium, characterized in that, the storage medium stores a computer program, which, when executed by a processor, causes the processor to implement the video sharing method according to claim 1.
